docs.text: MKDocs sample For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Install pip install mkdocs-material Quickstart - Create docs Init MKDocs. mkdocs new . Result tree . ├── docs │ └── index.md └── mkdocs.yml 1 directory, 2 files Specify a theme in mkdocs.yml . site_name : My Docs theme : name : material Run in local. mkdocs serve You can check on http://localhost:8000 Build docs. mkdocs build Files will be generated under site/ Publish with GitHub Pages ( gh-deploy branchにPush) Settings of GitHub Pages: Choose gh-pages branch. Create GitHub Actions (Build docs when a new change is pushed to main branch). name : publish on : push : branches : - main jobs : deploy : runs-on : ubuntu-latest steps : - uses : actions/checkout@v2 - uses : actions/setup-python@v2 with : python-version : 3.9 - run : pip install mkdocs-material - run : mkdocs gh-deploy --force Push the docs and GitHub Actions to main branch. Successfully published on https://about.nakamasato.com/mkdocs-material-sample/ (I use custom domain, the domain is http://about.nakamasato.com) (Optional) Change theme . You can choose a color: site_name : mkdocs sample theme : name : material palette : primary : cyan Tips 1. Codeblock in a list Need SuperFences extention markdown_extensions : - pymdownx.superfences Reference: https://github.com/squidfunk/mkdocs-material/issues/2639#issuecomment-834110977 2. Use math equation Add docs/javascripts/mathjax.js . window . MathJax = { tex : { inlineMath : [[ "\\(" , "\\)" ]], displayMath : [[ "\\[" , "\\]" ]], processEscapes : true , processEnvironments : true }, options : { ignoreHtmlClass : ".*|" , processHtmlClass : "arithmatex" } }; document $ . subscribe (() => { // MathJax . typesetPromise () }) Add the following lines to mkdocs.yml markdown_extensions : - pymdownx.arithmatex : generic : true extra_javascript : - javascripts/mathjax.js - https://polyfill.io/v3/polyfill.min.js?features=es6 - https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/mathjax@3/es5/tex-mml-chtml.js You can use equations. Examples: $$ \sum_{i=1}^{n} $$ \[ \sum_{i=1}^{n} \]
